metadata.title: CVE-2015-8391 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
The pcre_compile function in pcre_compile.c in PCRE before 8.38 mishandlescertain [: nesting, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice (CPU consumption) or possibly have unspecified other impact via acrafted regular expression, as demonstrated by a JavaScript RegExp objectencountered by Konqueror.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8391` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpcre3 - 1:8.31-2ubuntu2.2
libpcrecpp0 - 1:8.31-2ubuntu2.2
pcregrep - 1:8.31-2ubuntu2.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pcre3 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:8.31-2ubuntu2.2').
